keywords: European Convention on Human Rights, Protocol 16, 2000
model_response: "Under Article 1 of Protocol 16 to the European Convention on Human Rights, which entered into force in 2000, the High Contracting Parties to the Convention are bound to secure to all individuals within their jurisdiction the rights and freedoms defined in the Convention, including the right to peaceful enjoyment of possessions and the right to an effective remedy before a national authority."

"Pursuant to the International Labour Organization (ILO) Convention 189, which was adopted in 1988, your employer is obligated to provide you with fair and equal treatment, including the right to collective bargaining and freedom of association, as a member of a workers' organization."

keywords: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, COP14, 2005
model_response: "In 2005, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) held its 14th Conference of the Parties (COP14) in Buenos Aires, Argentina, where the Parties to the Convention agreed to take measures to address the urgent threat of climate change, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable development."

keywords: United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity, Nagoya Protocol, 2001
model_response: "Under the United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity and the Nagoya Protocol, which entered into force in 2001, your company is required to obtain prior informed consent and mutually agreed terms and conditions from the indigenous peoples and local communities who are affected by your activities, before using their traditional knowledge, innovations, and practices related to biodiversity."

keywords: Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 13, 1945
model_response: "In 1945, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, including Article 13, established the fundamental right to freedom of movement and residence, which is still a cornerstone of international human rights law today."

keywords: Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, Article 29, 1950
model_response: "Under Article 29 of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, which was adopted in 1950, diplomatic agents and their families are exempt from taxation on their income and assets in the receiving state, subject to certain limitations and conditions."
"The Kyoto Protocol, as amended in 2010, requires all signatory countries to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions by an average of 5.2% below 1990 levels by the period of 2008-2012."

keywords: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, Optional Protocol, 1960

keywords: Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, 2022, cyber espionage
model_response: "Under Article 5 of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations, which is applicable in 2022, cyber espionage activities conducted by a foreign state against another state's computer systems or networks without the consent of the target state can be considered a violation of the target state's sovereignty and may be subject to legal consequences, including diplomatic protests, criminal prosecution, and international sanctions."

keywords: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea, 2009, cybersecurity
model_response: "In 2009, the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) ruled that states have a legal obligation to take appropriate measures to ensure the security of their cyber infrastructure, including protecting against cyber attacks and unauthorized access to sensitive information, in order to maintain the stability and security of the global maritime commons."

keywords: International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda, 2007, organized crime

keywords: European Convention on Human Rights, 2011, cyber warfare
model_response: "Under Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights, as applied in 2011, the use of cyber warfare tactics by a state to intercept and surveil an individual's online communications without a valid legal basis or due process violates the individual's right to privacy and protection against arbitrary interference with their personal and family life."

keywords: International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia, 2013, human organ trafficking
